stimulusHtml: If a monopolist can increase output and profit by engaging in perfect price discrimination, allocative efficiency will
choicesHtml: improve even though consumer surplus goes to zero
possibly improve or get worse depending on whether consumer surplus increases or decreases
possibly improve or get worse depending on whether consumer surplus increases by more or less than the increase in producer surplus
get worse because producer surplus increases by more than the increase in consumer surplus
be unchanged because although producer surplus increases, total surplus is unaffected
